name: CKEDITOR.focusManager
doc:
Manages the focus activity in an editor instance. This class is to be used mainly by UI element coders when adding interface elements that need to set the focus state of the editor.

var focusManager = new CKEDITOR.focusManager( editor );
focusManager.focus();

members.name: currentActive
members.doc: Indicates the currently focused DOM element that makes the editor activated.

members.name: hasFocus
members.doc:
Indicates that the editor instance has focus.

alert( CKEDITOR.instances.editor1.focusManager.hasFocus ); // e.g. true
members.short_doc: Indicates that the editor instance has focus. ...

members.name: add
members.doc: Registers a UI DOM element to the focus manager, which will make the focus manager "hasFocus" once the input focus is relieved on the element. This method is designed to be used by plugins to expand the jurisdiction of the editor focus.

params.name: element
params.doc: The container (topmost) element of one UI part.

params.name: isCapture
params.doc: If specified, CKEDITOR.event.useCapture will be used when listening to the focus event.

members.short_doc:
Registers a UI DOM element to the focus manager, which will make the focus manager "hasFocus"
once the input focus is...

members.name: blur
members.doc:
Used to indicate that the editor instance has been deactivated by the specified element which has just lost focus.

Note: This function acts asynchronously with a delay of 100ms to avoid temporary deactivation. Use the noDelay parameter instead to deactivate immediately.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
editor.focusManager.blur();
members.short_doc:
Used to indicate that the editor instance has been deactivated by the specified
element which has just lost focus. ...

members.name: focus
members.doc:
Indicates that this editor instance is activated (due to a DOM focus change). The activated state is a symbolic indicator of an active user interaction session.

Note: This method will not introduce UI focus impact on DOM, it is here to record the editor UI focus state internally. If you want to make the cursor blink inside the editable, use CKEDITOR.editor.focus instead.

var editor = CKEDITOR.instances.editor1;
editor.focusManage.focus( editor.editable() );

params.name: currentActive
params.doc: The new value of the currentActive property.

members.short_doc: Indicates that this editor instance is activated (due to a DOM focus change). ...

members.name: lock
members.doc: Prevents from changing the focus manager state until the next unlock is called.
members.short_doc: Prevents from changing the focus manager state until the next unlock is called. ...

members.name: remove
members.doc: Dismisses an element from the focus manager delegations added by add.

params.name: element
params.doc: The element to be removed from the focus manager.

members.short_doc: Dismisses an element from the focus manager delegations added by add. ...

members.name: unlock
members.doc: Restores the automatic focus management if lock is called.
members.short_doc: Restores the automatic focus management if lock is called. ...

short_doc: Manages the focus activity in an editor instance. ...
